name: RI_1_1_18_1_Evidence_of_Record_Entry_Re_Activation_Event
title: RI.1.1.18.1 Evidence of Record Entry Re-Activation Event (Function)
description: Maintain Evidence of Record Entry Re-Activation Event
purpose: Evidence of Record Entry Re-Activation Event includes key metadata, ensures health record integrity (and trust) and enables record audit.

statement.label: RI.1.1.18.1#01
statement.requirement: The system SHALL audit each occurrence when destroyed or deprecated Record Entry content is re-activated.

statement.label: RI.1.1.18.1#02
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture identity of the organization where Record Entry content is reactivated.

statement.label: RI.1.1.18.1#03
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture identity of the patient who is subject of reactivated Record Entry content.

statement.label: RI.1.1.18.1#04
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture identity of the user reactivating Record Entry content.

statement.label: RI.1.1.18.1#05
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture identity of the system application which re-activated Record Entry content.

statement.label: RI.1.1.18.1#06
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture the type of Record Event trigger (i.e., re-activate).

statement.label: RI.1.1.18.1#07
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture the date and time Record Entry content is re-activated.

statement.label: RI.1.1.18.1#08
statement.requirement: The system SHOULD capture identity of the location (i.e., network address) where Record Entry content is re-activated.

statement.label: RI.1.1.18.1#09
statement.requirement: The system MAY capture the rationale for re-activating Record Entry content.
